metadata.title: CVE-2016-5200 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
V8 in Google Chrome prior to 54.0.2840.98 for Mac, and 54.0.2840.99 forWindows, and 54.0.2840.100 for Linux, and 55.0.2883.84 for Androidincorrectly applied type rules, which allowed a remote attacker topotentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5200` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
